stanza.line: My love is as a fever longing stillstill
For that which longer nurseth the diseasedisease
Feeding on that which doth preserve the illill
Th uncertain sickly appetite to pleaseplease
My reason the physician to my lovelove
Angry that his prescriptions are not keptkept
Hath left me and I desperate now approveapprove
Desire is death which physic did exceptexcept
Past cure I am now reason is past carecare
My thoughts and my discourse as mad men areare
At random from the truth vainly expressedexpressed
For I have sworn thee fair and thought thee brightbright
Who art as black as hell as dark as nightnight
